name: Extendy
tag_list: widgets, inline-web-toolbars, toolbars, webpage-toolbars, plugin, plugins, tc50-demopit09
overview:
Extendy takes the simplest functions for any blog/website and puts them into an inline webpage toolbar that resides at the bottom of webpages that have Extendy installed. Extendy is not a browser add-on by users, it is installed by blog/website owners. For a blog/website to install Extendy, they simply copy one-line of code into their website footer.

Extendy is fully customizable by websites â€“ from color schemes to the plugins that visitors can interact with. Publishers get stats to see engagement by their visitors with their various plugins, such as the sharing of their webpages on social sites like Twitter and Facebook.

Inline webpage toolbars exist in public or beta for some of the largest sites on the web: Facebook, YouTube, MySpace, Meebo, AOL (via Socialthing), Google Friend Connect, Ning, VideoEgg, etc.

Extendy believes all blog/websites will want their own inline webpage toolbar with functionality they select to offer their visitors.
